page.title: 15FARMING IN RAGLAN
page.content: {FARMING} The aspect of farming Mr.Bayliss enjoy's most is the constant looking forward.The issues that concern him as a farmer revolve chiefly around Britains membership of the Common Market Mr.Bayliss is not happy with a situation where Britain no longer fixes its own prices.He makes the observation that what suits one country does not necessarily suit another. Like all farmers he is concerned about mountains of wheat corn,beef,butter in fact everything except for lamb.In his view the farmer who is in the best position is the one who has a heavily subsidised poor hill farm or alternately the farmer who farms the rich fertile land of East Anglia.Mr.Bayliss concluded farming is more uncertain today than it has ever been.
